result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas G Griffin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
11/21/2017 - PER REQUEST, COURT MODIFIES EXTENDED SUPERVISION FROM 3 YEARS TO 2 YEARS.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation. Cash bail to be refunded to poster.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions.

No violent contact with Warren G or any family member. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain full time employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Straight Time. Sentence credit of 26 days were granted. TIME SERVED.
To be performed as a condition of probation, as directed by agent.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated * received and filed.
Hearing on May 17, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on May 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Defendant Douglas G Griffin in court by telephone with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court addresses the negative WCS report and reminds the Defendant it will not tolerate any further non compliance with WCS.   Attorney Menden is requesting an adjournment of today's hearing as the parties are still in negotations.  The Court schedules 16CF42 for trial and this case to tag along.  Hearing scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Hearing scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-06-2016 03:00 pm

Defendant Douglas G Griffin in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Menden requests an adjournment of the plea hearing as the the parties are still in negotiations but the Defendant will not be pursuing Drug Treatment Court.     The Court addresses the negative WCS report.  The Defendant is to go to his primary physician for any further prescriptions and to advise the physician of the pending charges.    The State takes no position on bond.  Bail remains as set and the Court reminds the Defendant the importance of remaining in compliance with WCS.  Attorney Menden requests the Court set the matter for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-03-2016 01:30 pm

Defendant Douglas G Griffin in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Michele Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Menden withdraws the motion to suppress.  Attorney Menden requests an adjournment of the status and trial date.   The parties advise the Court the Defendant would be interested in the Drug Treatment Court but the wait list is closed as of right now.     The Court adjourns the jury status hearing and the jury trial and sets the matter for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders motion to be filed within the next 2 weeks and be heard in November.  Jury status hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 10:30 am. Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Defendant Douglas G Griffin in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has an offer but does not have discovery yet. Defense requests another date. Court grants request. Defense to advise on the next date how they will proceed.  Hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on September 9, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Douglas G Griffin in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waukesha County Sheriff's Deputy Michael Pavlovich sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Hirt.   Cross examination by Attorney Menden.  State rests and moves for bind over.  Attorney Menden objects without further argument.    Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Attorney Menden withdraws her motion to modify bail.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 10:30 am.
